intro: Coccoloba floribunda, commonly known as the Florida hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in coastal areas and wetlands. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces showy, pinkish-white flowers. It is often found in sandy soils and can tolerate salt spray, making it a hardy coastal species. The plant is also known for its ability to thrive in wetland environments, contributing to its ecological significance in such habitats.
